title: College Seminar
desc: Small, writing and discussion-oriented course exploring a specific topic or theme, and introducing skills necessary to thriving at Northwestern. Not eligible to be applied towards a WCAS major or minor except where specifically indicated.

title: First-Year Writing Seminar
desc: Small, writing and discussion-oriented course exploring a specific topic or theme, and focused on the fundamentals of effective, college-level written communication. Not eligible to be applied towards a WCAS major or minor except where specifically indicated.

title: African Literature in Translation
desc: Continental African literature. Content varies. May be repeated for credit with different topic. Taught with COMP_LIT 270-0; may not receive credit for both courses with same topic. Literature Fine Arts Distro Area

title: Culture, Language, and Identity in South Africa
desc: Introduction to South African populations and cultures through direct experience and representations in history, art, literature, languages, and customs. Discussions of South African cultures and ethnicity, language use and policy, and identity. Restricted to students in Northwestern's South Africa program. Social Behavioral Sciences Distro Area

title: Topics in African Studies
desc: AFST 390-0 Topics in African Studies (1 Unit)

title: Topics in African Studies
desc: A general examination of topics relevant to African studies. May be repeated for credit with change of topic. Restricted to students in Northwestern's South Africa program.

title: Herskovits Undergraduate Research Award
desc: 2-course sequence required for recipients of the Herskovits Undergraduate Research Award. Consecutive enrollment required in AFST 392-2.

title: Herskovits Undergraduate Research Award
desc:
2-course sequence required for recipients of the Herskovits Undergraduate Research Award. 
Prerequisite: AFSTÂ 392-1.

title: Senior Research Seminar
desc: Capstone seminar addressing both techniques of research and the substance of a significant issue in African studies. Students develop skills at formulating a research topic and organizing research.

title: Independent Study
desc: May be repeated for credit with change of topic.
